verses.roman:
brahmā kahe,--'tāhā pāche kariba nivedana
eka saṁśaya mane haya, karaha chedana

synonyms: brahmā kahe—Lord Brahmā said; tāhā—that; pāche—later; kariba nivedana—I shall submit unto You; eka—one; saṁśaya—doubt; mane—in the mind; haya—there is; karaha chedana—kindly dissipate it.
translation: "Being questioned, Lord Brahmā immediately replied, 'I shall later tell You why I have come. First of all there is a doubt in my mind which I wish You would kindly dissipate.
